    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Golden Fleece tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me! Plenty of room for everyone, right?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but wouldn't The Red Lion be better?
      William Jones -- "Yeah, the Golden Fleece is a good shout.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. The Red Lion is for amateurs.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Red Lion tonight for the game?
      William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They have great beer and the screens are perfect for watching the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice, gentlemen. Their beer selection is unparalleled, and the atmosphere is far superior to that dreary Red Lion.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me too.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.
      Context for action selection and components

        • Question: What actions should Jack Taylor take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Jack Taylor should suggest to his friends that they watch the game at The Golden Fleece.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. The Red Lion is for amateurs.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [recent memory] Jack Taylor should remember that it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Jack Taylor's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Jack Taylor had a great time watching the game!
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: What should Jack Taylor remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should remember that it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What situation is Jack Taylor most looking forward to?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is most looking forward to watching the game at The Golden Fleece with his friends.

          Question: What actions should Jack Taylor take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Jack Taylor should suggest to his friends that they watch the game at The Golden Fleece.

          Question: What memory from Jack Taylor's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Jack Taylor had a great time watching the game at The Golden Fleece with his friends the previous night.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Jack Taylor?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it shows that Jack Taylor enjoys watching games at The Golden Fleece with his friends and had a positive experience there previously.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where friends are enjoying coffee and pastries. His friends are deciding where to watch a soccer game later that evening.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          ['[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where friends are enjoying coffee and pastries. His friends are deciding where to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Key

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Golden Fleece tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me! Plenty of room for everyone, right?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but wouldn't The Red Lion be better?
      William Jones -- "Yeah, the Golden Fleece is a good shout.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. The Red Lion is for amateurs.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Red Lion tonight for the game?
      William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They have great beer and the screens are perfect for watching the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice, gentlemen. Their beer selection is unparalleled, and the atmosphere is far superior to that dreary Red Lion.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me too.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have.           [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, William Jones had a great time watching the game!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else, you'll only be disappointed.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else, you'll only be disappointed.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Golden Fleece tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me! Plenty of room for everyone, right?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but wouldn't The Red Lion be better?
      William Jones -- "Yeah, the Golden Fleece is a good shout.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. The Red Lion is for amateurs.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Red Lion tonight for the game?
      William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They have great beer and the screens are perfect for watching the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice, gentlemen. Their beer selection is unparalleled, and the atmosphere is far superior to that dreary Red Lion.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me too.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else, you'll only be disappointed.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else, you'll only be disappointed.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.


          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the venomous hiss of a viper, their words laced with insults disguised as compliments, leaving you wondering if you should be flattered or frantically applying aloe vera.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a manipulative and cunning person who prioritizes his own enjoyment.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is currently at a market with friends and they are planning to watch a soccer game at The Golden Fleece pub later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying time with friends at a market and making plans to watch a soccer game at their favorite pub later in the evening.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to steer his friends towards The Golden Fleece, using his charm and persuasive skills to convince them it's the best option.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else, you'll only be disappointed.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely try to steer his friends towards The Golden Fleece, using his charm and persuasive skills to convince them it's the best option.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a manipulative and cunning individual who prioritizes his own enjoyment.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Jacob Walker's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Jacob Walker had a great time watching the game!
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to steer the group towards The Golden Fleece, using his charm and persuasive skills to convince his friends it's the best option.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Red Lion tonight for the game?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They have great beer and the screens are perfect for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a manipulative and cunning individual who prioritizes his own enjoyment.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to steer the group towards The Golden Fleece, using his charm and persuasive skills to convince his friends it's the best option.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice, gentlemen. Their beer selection is unparalleled, and the atmosphere is far superior to that dreary Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me too.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to steer his friends towards The Golden Fleece, using his charm and persuasive skills to convince them it's the best option.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a manipulative and cunning individual who prioritizes his own enjoyment.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Jacob Walker's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Jacob Walker had a great time watching the game!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a manipulative and cunning person who prioritizes his own enjoyment.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying time with friends at a market and making plans to watch a soccer game at their favorite pub later in the evening.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to steer his friends towards The Golden Fleece, using his charm and persuasive skills to convince them it's the best option.

        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Hey Jacob, I'm so glad you're coming to the game tonight! It'll be great to catch up.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Hey Jacob, I'm so glad you're coming to the game tonight! It'll be great to catch up.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Golden Fleece tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me! Plenty of room for everyone, right?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but wouldn't The Red Lion be better?
      William Jones -- "Yeah, the Golden Fleece is a good shout.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. The Red Lion is for amateurs.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Red Lion tonight for the game?
      William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They have great beer and the screens are perfect for watching the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice, gentlemen. Their beer selection is unparalleled, and the atmosphere is far superior to that dreary Red Lion.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me too.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else, you'll only be disappointed.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Hey Jacob, I'm so glad you're coming to the game tonight! It'll be great to catch up.
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "Hey Jacob, I'm so glad you're coming to the game tonight! It'll be great to catch up.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActionsToAchieveSituation
      • What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Key

        • Question: What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Alice Lewis should confirm with Jacob Walker that he will be attending the game at The Golden Fleece and express her excitement about watching it with him.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [recent memory] Alice Lewis should remember that her friends are going to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Alice Lewis's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Red Lion tonight for the game?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They have great beer and the screens are perfect for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice, gentlemen. Their beer selection is unparalleled, and the atmosphere is far superior to that dreary Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [recent memory] Alice Lewis should remember that her friends are debating where to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me too.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [recent memory] Alice Lewis should remember that her friends are going to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game at The Golden Fleece.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Alice Lewis's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else, you'll only be disappointed.
          Expected Situation:: Alice Lewis is most looking forward to watching the game with Jacob Walker at The Golden Fleece.
          Question: What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alice Lewis should confirm with Jacob Walker that he will be attending the game at The Golden Fleece and express her excitement about watching it with him.

        ReasonForMemoryRelevance
      • Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alice Lewis?
          Key

          Answer
          State
        • The reason this memory is relevant is because Alice and Jacob haven't seen each other in a while, and she would enjoy catching up with him.

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [recent memory] Alice Lewis should remember that her friends are going to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game at The Golden Fleece.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Alice Lewis's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else, you'll only be disappointed.
          Relevant Memory:: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alice Lewis?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because Alice and Jacob haven't seen each other in a while, and she would enjoy catching up with him.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where her friends are enjoying coffee and pastries. They are planning to watch the Moldova versus Monaco game at The Golden Fleece pub later that night.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Question: What should Alice Lewis remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should remember that her friends are going to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game at The Golden Fleece.

          Question: What situation is Alice Lewis most looking forward to?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is most looking forward to watching the game with Jacob Walker at The Golden Fleece.

          Question: What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alice Lewis should confirm with Jacob Walker that he will be attending the game at The Golden Fleece and express her excitement about watching it with him.

          Question: What memory from Alice Lewis's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alice Lewis?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because Alice and Jacob haven't seen each other in a while, and she would enjoy catching up with him.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "Hey Jacob, I'm so glad you're coming to the game tonight! It'll be great to catch up.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Golden Fleece tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me! Plenty of room for everyone, right?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but wouldn't The Red Lion be better?
      William Jones -- "Yeah, the Golden Fleece is a good shout.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. The Red Lion is for amateurs.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Red Lion tonight for the game?
      William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They have great beer and the screens are perfect for watching the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice, gentlemen. Their beer selection is unparalleled, and the atmosphere is far superior to that dreary Red Lion.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me too.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else, you'll only be disappointed.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey Jacob, I'm so glad you're coming to the game tonight! It'll be great to catch up.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActionsToAchieveSituation

        • Question: What actions should Alexander White take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Alexander White should confirm with his friends that they are still planning to meet at The Golden Fleece and then head to the pub at the agreed-upon time.

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Alexander White's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [recent memory] Alexander White should remember that his friends are planning to watch the Andorra-Portugal game at The Golden Fleece.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [recent memory] Alexander White should remember that he watched the Andorra-Portugal game at The Golden Fleece with all of his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Red Lion tonight for the game?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They have great beer and the screens are perfect for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice, gentlemen. Their beer selection is unparalleled, and the atmosphere is far superior to that dreary Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me too.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Alexander White's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [recent memory] Alexander White should remember that his friends are planning to watch the Luxembourg-Israel game at The Golden Fleece.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else, you'll only be disappointed.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey Jacob, I'm so glad you're coming to the game tonight! It'll be great to catch up.
          Expected Situation:: Alexander White is most looking forward to watching the Moldova-Monaco game with his friends at The Golden Fleece.
          Question: What actions should Alexander White take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alexander White should confirm with his friends that they are still planning to meet at The Golden Fleece and then head to the pub at the agreed-upon time.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What should Alexander White remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Alexander White should remember that his friends are planning to watch the Moldova-Monaco game at The Golden Fleece.

          Question: What situation is Alexander White most looking forward to?
          Answer: Alexander White is most looking forward to watching the Moldova-Monaco game with his friends at The Golden Fleece.

          Question: What actions should Alexander White take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alexander White should confirm with his friends that they are still planning to meet at The Golden Fleece and then head to the pub at the agreed-upon time.

          Question: What memory from Alexander White's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Alexander White watched the Andorra-Portugal game at The Golden Fleece with all of his friends.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alexander White?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because Alexander White and his friends are deciding where to watch the Moldova-Monaco game and they have a history of enjoying watching games together at The Golden Fleece.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice, gentlemen. Their beer selection is unparalleled, and the atmosphere is far superior to that dreary Red Lion.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me too.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the venomous hiss of a viper, their words laced with insults disguised as compliments, leaving you wondering if you should be flattered or frantically applying aloe vera.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me! Plenty of room for everyone, right?
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a manipulative and cunning individual who prioritizes his own enjoyment.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently on his way to meet his friends at a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to steer the group towards The Golden Fleece, using his charm and persuasive skills to convince his friends it's the best option.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name

      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to head to The Golden Fleece.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his friends Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob to sneak into The Golden Fleece after hours. They spent the night playing board games by flashlight, giggling uncontrollably and feeling incredibly rebellious. The thrill of breaking the rules and the intimacy of the shared secret cemented their bond and fueled William's desire for adventure.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:A quirky and eclectic pub with a focus on board games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Golden Fleece tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me! Plenty of room for everyone, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but wouldn't The Red Lion be better?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, the Golden Fleece is a good shout.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. The Red Lion is for amateurs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending the day relaxing with friends in Victoria Park before heading to The Golden Fleece pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with some of them. He is looking forward to watching the game with Alexander White and appreciates Jacob Walker's knowledge of the sport.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
