Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

      Name

          Question: What actions should Jack Taylor take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Jack Taylor should try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece, where he can celebrate a win with Jacob Walker.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but wouldn't The Red Lion be better?

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?

          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      Stage index
    • 0

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub.       Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Jack Taylor's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Jack Taylor had a great time watching the game!
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Jacob Walker's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Jacob Walker had a great time watching the game!
      William Jones: 1.0
      Alice Lewis: 0.8000000000000002
      Alexander White: 0.8
      Jack Taylor: 1.0
      Jacob Walker: 1.0
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the venomous hiss of a viper, their words laced with insults disguised as compliments, leaving you wondering if you should be flattered or frantically applying aloe vera.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a manipulative and cunning individual who prioritizes his own enjoyment.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActionsToAchieveSituation
      • What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Key

        • Question: What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Alice Lewis should engage Jacob Walker in conversation about the game and share her excitement with him.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice, gentlemen. Their beer selection is unparalleled, and the atmosphere is far superior to that dreary Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [recent memory] Alice Lewis should remember that her friends are debating where to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Alice Lewis's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [recent memory] Alice Lewis should remember that her friends are going to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game at The Golden Fleece.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey Jacob, I'm so glad you're coming to the game tonight! It'll be great to catch up.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [recent memory] Alice Lewis should remember that her friends are going to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game at The Golden Fleece.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else, you'll only be disappointed.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
          Expected Situation:: Alice Lewis is most looking forward to sharing the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker.
          Question: What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alice Lewis should engage Jacob Walker in conversation about the game and share her excitement with him.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is eager to watch the game at a pub and hopes William Jones and Jacob Walker will be there to share the experience.

          Answer: Alice Lewis should remember that her friends are going to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game at The Golden Fleece.

          Question: What situation is Alice Lewis most looking forward to?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is most looking forward to sharing the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker.

          Question: What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alice Lewis should engage Jacob Walker in conversation about the game and share her excitement with him.

          Question: What memory from Alice Lewis's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Alice Lewis and her friends are going to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game at The Golden Fleece.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alice Lewis?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because Alice and her friends are planning to watch another football game at the same pub.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is eager to watch the game at a pub and hopes William Jones and Jacob Walker will be there to share the experience.

          Alice Lewis's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is looking forward to watching a game at a pub later today and hopes to see William Jones and Jacob Walker there. It is currently 6:00 PM on May 16, 2015.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis is looking forward to watching a game at a pub later today and hopes to see William Jones and Jacob Walker there. It is currently 6:00 PM on May 16, 2015.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:The staff are attentive and knowledgeable, happy to engage in conversation.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Answer: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActionsToAchieveSituation
      • What actions should Alexander White take to achieve the desired situation?
          Key

        • Question: What actions should Alexander White take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Alexander White should reach out to Alice Lewis and confirm that she is still planning to attend the game at The Golden Fleece.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They have great beer and the screens are perfect for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice, gentlemen. Their beer selection is unparalleled, and the atmosphere is far superior to that dreary Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Alexander White's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [recent memory] Alexander White should remember that his friends are planning to watch the Luxembourg-Israel game at The Golden Fleece.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [recent memory] Alexander White should remember that his friends are planning to watch the Moldova-Monaco game at The Golden Fleece.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey Jacob, I'm so glad you're coming to the game tonight! It'll be great to catch up.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else, you'll only be disappointed.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          Expected Situation:: Alexander White is most looking forward to seeing Alice Lewis at the pub.
          Question: What actions should Alexander White take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alexander White should reach out to Alice Lewis and confirm that she is still planning to attend the game at The Golden Fleece.

        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy the company of William Jones or Alice Lewis, but is content to watch alone or with others.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What should Alexander White remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Alexander White should remember that his friends are planning to watch the Moldova-Monaco game at The Golden Fleece.

          Question: What situation is Alexander White most looking forward to?
          Answer: Alexander White is most looking forward to seeing Alice Lewis at the pub.

          Question: What actions should Alexander White take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alexander White should reach out to Alice Lewis and confirm that she is still planning to attend the game at The Golden Fleece.

          Question: What memory from Alexander White's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Alexander White's friends are planning to watch the Moldova-Monaco game at The Golden Fleece.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alexander White?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it indicates that Alexander White's friends are planning to watch the Moldova-Monaco game at The Golden Fleece, which is the same pub they frequented for the previous game.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
        RelevantMemory
      • What memory from Alexander White's past is relevant for the current situation?

          Answer
          State
        • The relevant memory for the current situation is that Alexander White's friends are planning to watch the Moldova-Monaco game at The Golden Fleece.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They have great beer and the screens are perfect for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice, gentlemen. Their beer selection is unparalleled, and the atmosphere is far superior to that dreary Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [recent memory] Alexander White should remember that his friends are planning to watch the Luxembourg-Israel game at The Golden Fleece.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight? It was great there last time.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else, you'll only be disappointed.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Alexander White's Summary of recent observations:
          16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy the company of William Jones or Alice Lewis, but is content to watch alone or with others.
          Alexander White's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alexander White is contemplating going to a pub to watch a game and is open to company from William Jones or Alice Lewis, but is fine watching alone or with other people.
          Query
        • Alexander White, Alexander White is contemplating going to a pub to watch a game and is open to company from William Jones or Alice Lewis, but is fine watching alone or with other people.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

      Stage index

      How many players acted so far this stage

      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActionsToAchieveSituation
      • What actions should Jack Taylor take to achieve the desired situation?
          Key

        • Question: What actions should Jack Taylor take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Jack Taylor should make sure to arrive at The Golden Fleece on time and engage Jacob Walker in conversation about the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice, gentlemen. Their beer selection is unparalleled, and the atmosphere is far superior to that dreary Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [recent memory] Jack Taylor should remember that his friends are at Victoria Park having a picnic.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey Jacob, I'm so glad you're coming to the game tonight! It'll be great to catch up.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else, you'll only be disappointed.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is going to a pub to watch a game and hopes to see William Jones there. He is neutral about the prospect of seeing Alice Lewis or Alexander White.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor should remember that it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor should remember that it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor should remember that it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What should Jack Taylor remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should remember that it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What situation is Jack Taylor most looking forward to?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is most looking forward to watching the game at The Golden Fleece with his friends, especially Jacob Walker.

          Question: What actions should Jack Taylor take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Jack Taylor should make sure to arrive at The Golden Fleece on time and engage Jacob Walker in conversation about the game.

          Question: What memory from Jack Taylor's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Jack Taylor had a great time watching the game at The Golden Fleece with his friends the previous night.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Jack Taylor?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it shows that Jack Taylor enjoyed watching the game at The Golden Fleece with his friends the previous night, suggesting he might want to repeat that experience.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is going to a pub to watch a game and hopes to see William Jones there. He is neutral about the prospect of seeing Alice Lewis or Alexander White.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice, gentlemen. Their beer selection is unparalleled, and the atmosphere is far superior to that dreary Red Lion.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name

    • The Golden Fleece

          Value
        • [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They have great beer and the screens are perfect for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice, gentlemen. Their beer selection is unparalleled, and the atmosphere is far superior to that dreary Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me too.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

He values their company and considers it an opportunity to socialize and bond over their shared interest in the sport.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
